intro: Suessenguthia barthleniana, commonly known as the Barthlen's suessenguthia, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, lowland environments. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks, thriving in nutrient-rich soils. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
